paper_abstract: For 1 <= i <= k, let R-i denote p(i) (y) F-i + G(i), where p(i) (y) is a polynomial in y with integer coefficients, and F-i, G(i) are linear polynomials in x(1),..., x(n) with integer coefficients. Let P(z(1),..., z(k)) be a Presburger relation over the nonnegative integers. We show that the following problem is decidable: Given: R-1,R-..., R-k and a Presburger relation P. Question: Are there nonnegative integer values for y,x(1),..., x(n) such that for these values, (R-1,..., R-k) satisfies P? C We also give some applications to decision problems concerning counter machines. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the solvability of a class of diophantine equations and applications
